Yes, truffle hunting in Tuscany is highly dependent on the season, as truffles have a specific growing season. The most common type of truffle found in Tuscany is the white truffle, which grows from September to January. Black truffles are also found in Tuscany, and they are in season from late November to March.

It's essential to note that the availability of truffle hunting tours may vary from year to year, depending on the weather and truffle yields. It's best to book in advance and check with the tour provider to make sure that truffle hunting is available at the time of your visit. Also, truffle hunting is typically conducted in the early morning or late afternoon and lasts a few hours. 

Overall, truffle hunting in Tuscany is a unique and exciting way to experience the region’s cuisine, and visiting during the truffle season is a perfect opportunity to try different truffle-based dishes and immerse yourself in the local culinary scene.
